subject: Psychology
title: Groupthink
description: A micro-lesson that makes Groupthink usable.

hook.text: NASA engineers had doubts about the Challenger launch. Nobody spoke up. The shuttle exploded 73 seconds after liftoff.

buildup.text: Groupthink occurs when a cohesive group prioritizes agreement over critical evaluation of alternatives.

discovery.text: Irving Janis identified symptoms: illusion of invulnerability, self-censorship, and pressure on dissenters.

twist.text: The smarter and more cohesive the group, the more vulnerable to groupthink. Expertise doesn't protect against it.

climax.text: Prevention requires assigning a devil's advocate, welcoming criticism, and consulting outsiders before deciding.

punchline.text: The most dangerous group is one that never disagrees.

quiz.question: What is groupthink?
options: When a group prioritizes agreement over critical thinking
When individuals think independently in groups
A technique for brainstorming better ideas
